title: Broadway Massage
description:
This was my latest project, and one I really enjoyed because it started with a simple, local connection. I found Broadway Massage, a **local Chicago spa**, while walking my dog. The owners were incredibly kind, but their digital presence was in desperate need of a refresh; the old website was **outdated**, had a **poor layout**, and was **not mobile-friendly**.

My work went beyond just a simple redesign. I built them a **modern**, **responsive landing page** that beautifully showcases their services and atmosphere. But I also provided a more complete digital overhaul by updating and optimizing their **Yelp**, **Google Maps**, and **Google Business Profile** pages to ensure consistency and professionalism across all platforms. A key part of the project was also ensuring the new website was properly **listed on Google's Search Engine** to help new customers find them.

I'm incredibly happy with the final design. Initially, we planned to build a **custom booking system** with Google's Calendar API, but the client decided it was more than they needed for their current operations. I respected their decision, as it was a great lesson in building what a client truly needs, not just what's technically possible. It was a rewarding experience to help a great local business put their best foot forward online.

title: JP Photography
description:
This project is a **demonstration portfolio** I designed for a fictional photographer, James Peterson. The goal was to create a **visually stunning** and highly functional website tailored specifically for **creative professionals**. I focused on an elegant, **image-centric experience** where the photography itself is the star, supported by a clean and modern design that enhances the artwork without distracting from it.

The site features a fully **responsive layout**, a minimalist UI, and clear calls-to-action like "**View Gallery**" and "**Book a Session**" to guide visitors and convert them into clients. It also includes essential business elements like client testimonials and experience metrics to build trust. Ultimately, this demo serves as a perfect example of my ability to build a polished, professional online presence for any brand that needs to make a strong visual impact.

title: Kovia LLC
description:
This project began as a custom build for a **B2B micro-services provider**, a call center that could assign specialized teams to handle any given task. However, after I completed the website, the client unfortunately never proceeded with the launch. Rather than let the work go to waste, I rebranded it and have kept it as a **demonstration site**, as it remains one of the most beautiful and technically advanced websites I've ever built.

The site is packed with features designed for a professional, international business audience. Its most advanced feature is a complete **internationalization (i18n) system** for seamless **English-Spanish translations**. It **automatically detects** the user's browser language but also includes a clean, simple language switcher for manual control. The design is clean, corporate, and data-driven, built to establish trust with potential clients by highlighting key metrics like "**95% Customer Satisfaction**".

While it's a shame it never went live for the original client, this project is now a powerful showcase of my capabilities. It demonstrates my ability to build a sophisticated, feature-rich web application with a polished UI, comprehensive pages for services and FAQs, and advanced functionalities like i18n. It stands as a testament to the kind of high-quality, professional landing page I can create for any business.

title: Ofibodegas Centro 9
description:
This was my third commercial project and a significant step in my professional journey. I partnered with a **Nicaragua-based business** to build the primary website for their new real estate development, "Ofibodegas": a unique concept combining office and warehouse space. The client was just starting out with little more than 3D renders and land layouts, so my task was to create a digital presence that would build credibility and attract serious **investors and business tenants** from the ground up.

The website needed to be a comprehensive resource for high-value leads. I built out numerous features, including a downloadable business PDF, detailed sections on **facility benefits**, a thorough **FAQ**, and a **secure contact form** to handle inquiries. Anticipating that the client would need to make frequent updates as the project developed, I decided to explore a more robust solution. This was the first project where I integrated a **headless CMS (PayloadCMS)**, which gave the client full control over their content and also managed their contact form submissions.

After a few redesigns, we landed on a final version that I'm very proud of and, most importantly, the client is pleased with. This project was a major milestone for me; it involved navigating the complexities of an **international client** relationship and pushed me to implement more advanced, scalable backend solutions. It was a challenging but incredibly rewarding experience that significantly leveled up my skills.

title: GA World Fashion
description:
This was one of my **first professional projects**, built for a family member's high-end **tailoring business** in the Miami area. The client needed an elegant online presence but gave me **minimal direction**, so I had the creative freedom to interpret her brand's essence, "Tailored Elegance", and translate it into a fitting digital experience.

The solution was a **two-page design** that guides visitors through the brand's story in a clean, linear way. I'm particularly proud of the **simplistic but straight-to-the-point UI**, which uses clear calls-to-action like "**Schedule an Appointment**" to encourage personal consultations, not just online sales. The result is a sophisticated **digital brochure** that captures the brand's exclusive feel and taught me a valuable lesson in brand strategy.

title: Bleeding Hearts Across America
description:
This project is incredibly close to my heart. I serve as a **member of the board** and the **CTO** for Bleeding Hearts Across America (BHAA), a passionate, **youth-run non-profit** dedicated to serving the **South Florida** community. When I joined, their online presence didn't fully capture the energy of their mission, so they needed a professional and welcoming website to act as a central hub for donors, volunteers, and the community they support.

Working closely with the founder, I **led the development** of their new website from the ground up. The goal was to build a digital reflection of the organization's spirit: **caring, effective, and community-focused**. We created a platform that tells their story through **authentic visuals** and makes it incredibly simple for visitors to take action with **clear calls-to-action** for donations and volunteering.

The site now serves as the organization's official **digital headquarters**, helping them connect with more supporters and streamline their outreach. On a personal level, this was my **first serious project** and the one that truly **solidified my confidence** as a developer. It proved to me that thoughtful code can be a powerful **tool for social good**.
